intro: Chaenostoma cinereum, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Chaenostoma cinereum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
